Users Database Helpers (users_service/database.py)¶

This part of the project is for talking to the users SQLite database.

users_service.database.delete_user_row(username)¶

Delete a user row by username. takes as parameters username : str

Username of the user to remove.

Returns Number of rows deleted (0 if nothing matched).

users_service.database.find_user_by_email(email)¶

Look up one user by email address. takes as parameters: email : str

Email address to search for.

Returns

Matching user row as a dict, or None if not found.

users_service.database.find_user_by_username(username)¶

Look up one user by username. takes as parameters username : str

Username to search for.

Returns

Matching user row as a dict, or None if not found.

users_service.database.get_db_connection()¶

Open a connection to the users database and return it. The connection uses sqlite3.Row so we can access columns by name. The caller is responsible for closing the connection when finished.

users_service.database.insert_user(name, username, email, role, password_hash)¶

Insert a new user row and return it as a dict. it takes as parameters: name : str

Full name of the user.

usernamestr

Chosen username (must be unique).

emailstr

Email address (must be unique).

rolestr

Role string, for example "admin" or "regular".

password_hashstr

Hashed password, already processed by the caller.

Returns The newly inserted row as a dict, or None if something went wrong.

users_service.database.list_all_users()¶

Return all users in the database as a list of dicts.

users_service.database.make_users_table_if_missing()¶

Create the users table if it does not already exist.

just called once at startup so the rest of the code can assume that the table is there and ready to use.

users_service.database.update_user_row(username, new_name, new_email, new_role, new_password_hash=None)¶

Update a user row and return the updated row. takes as parameters username : str

Username of the user to update.

new_namestr

New name to store.

new_emailstr

New email to store.

new_rolestr

New role to store.

new_password_hashstr, optional

New hashed password. If None, the password is not changed.

Returns

Updated user row as a dict, or None if something went wrong.
